name: Ruby - Performance Monitoring
description: Advanced Ruby configuration with performance monitoring and custom hooks
useCase: Production Ruby applications requiring detailed performance insights
seGuidance: Use this configuration for high-traffic Ruby applications. The before_send hook allows filtering or modifying events before they're sent. Use traces_sampler for dynamic sampling based on transaction context. The inspect_exception_causes_for_exclusion setting helps with exception filtering.
configCode:
Sentry.init do |config|
  config.dsn = ENV['SENTRY_DSN']
  config.environment = Rails.env
  config.release = ENV.fetch('SENTRY_RELEASE', '1.0.0')
  
  # Performance monitoring
  config.traces_sample_rate = 0.1
  
  # Custom traces sampler
  config.traces_sampler = lambda do |sampling_context|
    transaction_context = sampling_context[:transaction_context]
    
    # Don't trace health checks
    if transaction_context[:name] == 'GET /health'
      return 0.0
    end
    
    # Sample API calls at 10%
    0.1
  end
  
  # Filter events before sending
  config.before_send = lambda do |event, hint|
    # Filter out specific errors
    if hint[:exception].is_a?(MyApp::IgnoredException)
      return nil
    end
    
    # Scrub sensitive data
    event.extra.delete(:password) if event.extra
    event
  end
  
  # Inspect exception causes for exclusion
  config.inspect_exception_causes_for_exclusion = true
  
  # Breadcrumb settings
  config.max_breadcrumbs = 100
  config.capture_exception_frame_locals = true
end
